DataElement.preferredName: Metastatic Disease Anatomic Location Organ Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Amount of organ sites within the body that contain metastatic disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: (MET-uh-STAT-ik) Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from one part of the body to another._A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown._Relating to anatomy._A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (MET-uh-STAT-ik) Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from one part of the body to another.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Relating to anatomy.:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

Concepts.definition: A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/17/17 tt transferred context, added reg status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology._A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus._Determining the number or amount of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.

Concepts.definition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology._A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus._Determining the number or amount of something.

Concepts.definition: A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology.

A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.
Determining the number or amount of something.
